restaurant_name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

questions.content: Is er in 2019 ook voor de jarige nog gratis 3 gangen menu ?

mediaList.caption: Groentenkroketje en nog even naproeven van alle lekkere hapjes!

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Disappointment
reviews.text:
After waiting 20 minutes myself asked if we could order something.
We ordered 2 cappucino and 1 sandwich ruin red ham/cheese.
Took another 15 minutes before ce coffee came and this was not really hot.
After another 15 minutes asked about the sandwich, oh sorry said the waiter, he was so on the robot that we had seen for 10 minutes. This one was also cold and I didn't wear it. This reported at checkout, all that was said was apology ma'am. What a deception, while we often have a cup of coffee or eat in the restaurant.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Booming business
reviews.text: Lunch time is a  busy time at the Van der Valk restaurant. And that is not difficult to understand. Close to exit 20 of the A15 motorway. Ample free parking at the immense hotel parking area. Spacious, light restaurant area, also an outdoor seating area, open when the weather is clement. A good selection on the menu of popular well prepared food. To top this off, friendly service of the staff. This results in a booming lunch business. But what regretfully also is booming, are the prices of the food and drinks. But that is the malady the whole Dutch restaurant branch is suffering from. No special reproach for Van der Valk in this review. A four point rating.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text:
The menu has changed and as far as I am concerned this is not progress. Especially the desserts suck. I have tried a number of desserts and found it disappointing every time and absolutely not worth its money.  

This time we had the Pavlova with mandarin: 3, very badly cleaned wedges of tangerine (the white skins were still attached, just laxity of the kitchen) on a factory meringue, meagrely doused with some tangerine syrup, a dollop of unsafe cream and 1 measly wafer-thin mint-chat cup that was broken into 3 pieces. 

And the Dubai Triffle: a whiskey glass (!!) with a few chunks of dry puff pastry on the bottom (I think that was supposed to be the baklava), topped with a thick layer of tasteless greasy cream (so-called white chocolate mousse) topped with some crumbled pistachios (I think 3 nuts together). 
What a travesty. 
We think de Valk is a nice hotel and in the lounge bar we like to come but this makes no sense. 
Anyway, serving the desserts in those glasses is annoying. It eats awkwardly and is just a trick to mask the meagre portions. 
And all very well at the price, and that wouldn't be so bad, if it was tasty. But that's not it. I wonder if the management or the chef ever tastes these desserts themselves and likes it (and worth €8.50!).

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: fun cycling holiday
reviews.text:
Good location and clean room. It was a bit hot there.
Good breakfast and delicious 3 course menu. Nice terrace with smooth and friendly service. 
Closed bicycle storage.
We will definitely be back!

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Lunch on our way home
reviews.text: We had a short family stay  in a holiday home on De Veluwe; on the last morning we had to vacate the home of course at 11.00 a.m. What about a nice leisurely lunch on our way home to top off a pleasant stay. Almost immediately Van Der Valk Ridderkerk was suggested. And for good reasons. Almost right on the way home, large parking area, spacious restaurant, friendly and professional service, a passable selection of tasty food and, for a Dutch restaurant, a reasonable bill. (Dutch restaurants are generally notorious for the inflated prices). And don't forget the famous Van Der Valk Ridderkerk tompouce  as dessert. Again a well deserved four point rating.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Very yummy - for all who are not able to make a decision
reviews.text: It was a perfect location for an electric car driver. There are many facilities for charging the car and having a great meal in the restaurant—a nice restaurant to have Holland on one plate. So you get a variation of some signature dishes to try. It was a perfect lunch, and the waiters were very friendly.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Not worthy of Van der Valk
reviews.text:
Had to wait a very long time for main course. With apologies, these had been ready for fifteen minutes, the waiter said. 
We did not find the dishes we ordered to be what we are used to at Van de Valk. Oriental dish extremely salty, too much ham with too little asparagus, lukewarm potatoes... really too bad for the 150 we had to pay!

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Excellent service for lunch
reviews.text: I was here having lunch with my daughter. Very nice and clean restaurant. Excellent service from the host Denise Schot, she treated us very well. Fast and very friendly. She advised me because I didn't know what to eat. He was very rich and explained more about the hotel to us. I will surely return with my entire family.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Sad but true.
reviews.text: Little choice, deer steak with red cabbage, little taste and it seemed like composite fake meat for a considerable amount. It's a shame you're not used to Van der Valk.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: My experience is not what I expected from a Van der Valk.
reviews.text:
Ate at Valk Ridderkerk for the first time, but the last time.
As a starter capaccio this was not fresh capaccio.
As a main course, the snittsel was dry and had little taste and then there was also an extra charge for the sauce, which I have never experienced at Van de Valk. All in all, little experience and atmosphere and the food was of poor quality.
Not what you expect from De Valk.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Hotel very good!
reviews.text:
The atmosphere of the restaurant really resembles a train station hall.
Service not friendly.
Food leaves a lot to be desired,
Prices too high!
Staff at the hotel reception very friendly and helpful.
Would come back to the hotel anytime, everything very clean and well-maintained, but would no longer visit the restaurant.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Often selected for lunch
reviews.text: Van der Valk restaurant in Ridderkerk is often selected for lunch because: Easily reached from the A15 motorway, exit Barendrecht. Huge free parking area. Spacious restaurant. Nice outdoor seating area when the weather is clement. Friendly staff. Compact menu with something for everybody's taste. Predictable food quality, always tasty. Prices were a bit hiked this time, due to inflation they say, but still just affordable. Remember, Dutch restaurant prices are the highest in Europe. And the deciding factor, the Van der Valk 'Tompouce' pastry. Tompouce pastry can be bought at every bakery in the Netherlands, but the Van der Valk Ridderkerk version is the champion. Delicious.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Good lunch, good service, ample free parking
reviews.text: The title of this review says it all. For a predictable good lunch, served by polite and dedicated staff, go to Van Der Valk restaurant incorporated in the hotel with the same name in Ridderkerk. Ample free parking is provided for, as the hotel is prepared for welcoming plenty of guests. Granted, the food shall never break into the Michelin star elite, but the food is tasty and plentiful all the same with an acceptable bill in the end. I want to stress the quality of the service in the restaurant. Polite and hospitable service is hard to find in Dutch restaurants, but here at Van Der Valk the service was perfect. To be recommended.

photo.caption: The restaurant garden with seating area

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Surprisingly cosy
reviews.text: When you see the forbidding high rise of the Van Der Valk hotel Ridderkerk, when traveling over the six lane A15, you would hesitate to believe that behind that building is a cosy garden with outdoor tables, where you can have a good and tasty lunch. But I can assure you, TA friends, that it is precisely the case. Ample free parking is available at the hotel premises,  and the door to the garden is only steps away from the restaurant entrance inside the hotel building. We selected a table under a canopy to be out of the sun. The restaurant offers an extensive lunch menu of cold and hot dishes. The food is well prepared and well presented. See the pictures. Service of the staff is prompt, dedicated and friendly, making you feel at home. Prices are moderate for Dutch restaurants price levels. To be recommended.

photo.caption: A generous burger with fries for lunch

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Very good, friendly staff
reviews.text: We had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant, good quality, we loved it. The waiting staff was friendly. Breakfast was a buffet and there was amble choice.

locations.localizedName: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for fall travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Explore fall travel destinations, vacation ideas and things to do, and get information on when and where to see the best fall foliage.

articleContent.title: 12 best chocolate shops in Paris to delight your sweet tooth

seoInfo.metaDescription: On the search for the best chocolate in Paris? Here are the best chocolate shops in Paris—including Angelina's hot chocolate—to get the best chocolate, cakes, eclairs and more.

tripContent.title: Where to experience adventure in Louisville
tripContent.description: You don't need to wait until Derby Day for thrill and adventure in Louisville. From zip-lining through caverns to paddle boarding on the Ohio River, check out these exciting attractions.

articleContent.title: Why Greenville, SC is the perfect mix of adventure and luxury

seoInfo.metaDescription: There are few places that blend luxury and outdoor adventure like Greenville, South Carolina. The days (and mild weather) are made for adrenaline rushes of all types, while the region’s spas, fine dining, and boutique properties serve up luxury experiences that last well into the evening. It’s not hard to dive into a handful of the many treats on offer, and crafting an itinerary that incorporates a little bit of everything is how you’ll find yourself with a Greenville-shaped spot forever in your heart.
If you're torn between Cabo or Cancun for your next vacation, here's what to know before booking.

articleContent.title: Your Ultimate Melbourne Summer with AO Travel & Experiences Packages

seoInfo.metaDescription: It’s game, set, and a winning Melbourne adventure for tennis fans heading to the Australian Open in January. With AO Travel & Experiences - the official travel provider of the AO - you’ll make the most of every break in play, stepping beyond the court to discover everything the vibrant city of Melbourne has to offer.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Top class food, service and ambience
reviews.text: Our first visit here for dinner and it was very memorable.  The food was delectable, well cooked and tasted divine.  The service was polite and professional and it was good to see the food come out in such a way that all of our large group ate at the same time.  The ambience (or gezelligheid as the Dutch say) was excellent - highly recommend and would definitely come again.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.text: Very good food and very nice staff. Price maybe a little expensive, but you're in a 4 star hotel and this in normal.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: romantic night away
reviews.text: Sat outside in the garden in the Sunshine with a bottle of rose Then we had the life cooking buffet. All you can eat and drink and a wide choice of entrees -main meal and desserts

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: So nearly very good
reviews.text:
I chose the miso soup, followed by pan fried veal liver. The veal liver was excellent, and it came with onion gravy, potatoes sautéed with bacon, and apple compote with sultanas. All good, but the asparagus seemed out of place on the plate, though I have to admire anyone getting fresh asparagus in s plate in February. I’m not quite sure what someone thought side dishes of French fries, broccoli covered with Hollandaise sauce, and tomato salsa would bring to the dish!
The large and nicely decorated restaurant was nearly full on a Thursday evening, and many diners were clearly locals.
The service was faultless.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Fantastic food
reviews.text:
Great menu, great staff.
Friendly quick service and great food. There is a great selection to suit many tastes
Highly recommended

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Very good meals
reviews.text: had 6 days at this hotel - this hotel had excellent breakfast choices & we had evening meals 3 x 3  course meals - all of a very good quality, & service with a very good maitr'e de.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Always flexible
reviews.text:
What you would really like is not on the menu..... don't worry. 
Tell what sort of food you woulld like and you can be sure to get a choice that will please you.
The wine suggestions are to be considered, they are good.
Enter, sit down, relax and enjoy the food the drinks, the company.
Can't go wrong

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Birthday treat.
reviews.text: Got taken here by friends,for a birthday treat. Thr food, service and outdoor setting were all excellent. The ambiance was good,and waiters and waitresses were very attentive. The car parking was free which was an added bonus.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Fresh and great food selection
reviews.text: Besides the amazing and fresh food selection, nice seating and friendly staff, good location of restaurant, free parking

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Nothing special
reviews.text: We dined here with a friend and maybe Sunday was a bad day because it was busy and the service was slow and the food not anything special. Ample servings but not very tasty. We had fish and Indonesian sate which was really not authentic. Guess we should have stuck to beefsteak! Moderate prices and pleasant ambiance.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Very nice. High value for adequate money
reviews.text:
I had not too much time. Just wanted to have a quick but not too quick dinner. I was pleasantly surprised with gentle and speedy service. Especially if you have an appointment later on you don’t want your dinner in the last 15 minutes. 

Quality of food is great. Everything nicely prepared. Not too hot, not too cold, not too raw, not overcooked. Exactly right !!! 

In the end I had time to write this review rather than speeding to my appointment!

photo.caption: This is a very nice restaurant. Vegetarian food (allthough I eat quite some fish and meat) is gr

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Good food for value
reviews.text:
Nice and cosy restaurant with friendly staff.
Food was served fast and was tasted delicious. A lot of choices on the card.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Not bad but could be better
reviews.text: For lunch it's extremely busy, which is good. My omelette was excellent but my wife's tomato soup was from the AH can or alike, which is not what you expect. Service is good and fast. Prices are very reasonable

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: good food, in large but cosy restaurant for a good price
reviews.text: Lik most van der Valk restaurant and hotels, good foor for a good price (yes I know there are quality differenced between the van der Valk restaurant), but this place 8/10

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Basic food restaurant
reviews.text:
As well as the service is OK, the menu is very basic and the cooking is medium. There is an opportunity to enjoy a buffet restaurant, the time-frame is rather too short if you are not advised to get in as they start the time-frame.
The hotel and the service are great, nearby Rotterdam and rooms are spacious.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Hotel van der valk ridderkerk
reviews.text:
Good hotel, rooms are all very spacious, with a nice shower and large bath.
TV in the room, a refrigerator that you can fill or fill in.
Breakfast is great ... bicycle hire is possible.
Nearby are the kfc and the mcdonalds ;-) if you want to ff ff, otherwise the food in the hotel is also very good.
Near a train station, from there quickly to Rotterdam etc.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Few days away with my mum
reviews.text: Amazing food. Staff really friendly.  Service was in good time, long enough for food to be cooked just right and not rushed but also not too long to wait. Would definitely recommend.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Good restaurant and hotel
reviews.text: The restaurant is really good, both the a-la-carte restaurant as the buffet restaurant. And the hotel is really nice for business or leisure visits. Big and free parking area and easy to reach by car or public transport.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Special dishes high tea but the ingredients in the food dont combine well
reviews.text: They probably tried to create a unique high tea but the strange flavour combinatitions they put in every item do not work. I did not enjoy the food.The amount is more then sufficient so not a total loss, but I wont be returning.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Why all the potatoes ?
reviews.text: The restaurant is open until 11pm. The menu felt a bit uninspired and I settled with vegetarian ravioli. The ravioli was really good but why was it served with French fries and pan fried and broccoli with cheese as sides? The ravioli filled me up and to be healthy I tried the broccoli but it had a funny taste.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Very tasty and beautiful plating
reviews.text: Menu has a good variety although I wish they had more chicken dishes - currently only a chicken stir fry in peanut oil.  Tenderloin Steak is tender and they cook it to your liking.  Every table gets 3 cups of different veggies- 2 types of potatoes and 1 veggie.  Only thing better would be if they offered some rolls with butter or olive oil.with dinner.  Desserts are excellent, almost too pretty to eat.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Very good stake and fish, fried potatoes not so good. The place is very crowded especially on weekends.
reviews.text: We were two couples eating dinner. The service was very good and very efficient. The pork stake was very good as well as the fish (do not remember which kind). Unfortunately, the french fries were cold and soggy and the salad was difficult to eat.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Quality Hotel for Business
reviews.text:
Stayed at the Hotel Ridderkerk for a short business trip during early Aug 2016, my over all impressions were very pleasant with a good room and bathroom facilities. The hotel is situated a short drive or taxi ride from the Train Station.

Very pleasant and would stay again, staff were friendly and helpful.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Summer menu
reviews.text: Sometimes you just don't want to go out the hotel to have a meal. Always a risk, limited choice, overpriced ... Not at Van der Valck. I've had the summer menu and that was a unexpected treat. 3 courses, beautifully dressed in the plates, perfectly prepared and very tasty! They'll see me again!

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: It's only food: consistently mediocre
reviews.text: This restaurant is nearby and provides a place to catch up with a friend : it's not pretty,  charming,  warm or homely. It's not welcoming. It's clean and comfortable and the music is not too loud. It's a pragmatic choice and food goes from OK to bad. Service in the main is of the same quality as the cooking : dependant on the moods of the waiting staff and the chef. My beef salad last night was composed of large chunks of cold steak that had been fried and then coated with uncooked Curry spices. Some chewy cubes of dried apple,  one (1!) walnut and a dressing that was under par in every way: meager and tasteless. My friend's goat cheese salad was a huge wheel of cheese on a bed of leaves and way too many untrusted hazelnuts. The Gluten-Free bread rolls were the only really good part of the meal. My consolation in this case: Geez-Louise it's only food. But a waste of good opportunities and once again the wish to kick somebody there into gear

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Typical Van Der Valk
reviews.text: Very friendly staff and a good service. The presentation and the food quality are good. The portion are OK, the price is kinda normal for this kind of **** hotel. So, theoverall experience is good

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Mother's Day Brunch
reviews.text:
We did brunch before at several Van der Valk restaurant in the Netherlands. We are familiar about the concept. 

But brunch this time..... on this Special Day..... really disappointed us all. The food offer is nothing special. It feels like as if  this restaurant has stayed behind comparing to the other Van der Valk restaurant like the one in Almere or Hoofddorp.

But one thing this restaurant excel in is the way they entertain the small people in our companies.

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: Great food and nicely decorated
reviews.text: Everything I have ordered here has been delicious, and the breakfast is very good as well. Steaks, fish, and a nice wine selection, all very good

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: disappointing
reviews.text:
I eat same times for work in this restaurant,
The poor service people are really incompetent room, many times the plates arrive late, the products used are discrete quality flunked price!
I think it is almost all cooked in the microwave, I remain stunned by the flow of people eating here! I think it is just a matter of convenience because of the free parking!

location.name: Van der Valk Hotel Restaurant Ridderkerk

reviews.title: A* Food
reviews.text: When i was on business, i went to the hotel restaurant each evening. I would reccomend booking as it was very busy all nights. The food was served piping hot and looked professional. I really enjoyed the steak served with pepercorn sauce and fries. The restaurant serves all of it's meals with unlimited fries and vegetables. Would highly reccommend a visit.
